name: No 1 Halal Kitchen
halal_reasoning: Listed as halal Chinese on OSM with diet:halal=yes tag. Multiple sources confirm 'only halal Chinese food' served. Grubhub and Yelp listings consistently describe as halal. Owner Iftekhar praised for halal offerings. Sources: Yelp, Grubhub, menu-world.com

name: No Pork Halal Kitchen
halal_reasoning: Established halal restaurant since 2005, described as 'one of the oldest halal restaurants in Brooklyn.' Visit Brooklyn and multiple sources confirm 100% halal food. Name explicitly states 'No Pork Halal.' Sources: visitbrooklyn.nyc, Yelp, netwaiter.com

name: No Pork In My Fork Columbia Coffee & Grill
halal_reasoning: Food cart with 'no pork in my fork' motto. Yelp lists as halal food stand. Reviews confirm falafel cart serving halal items. Turkey or beef bacon used instead of pork. Limited official verification. Sources: Yelp, Foursquare

name: Noodlefan
halal_reasoning: Thai restaurant with no halal mention in any search results. Menu includes pork dishes like 'Pork Tom Yum Noodle.' No halal signage or certification found. Standard Thai establishment. Sources: Yelp, Tripadvisor, Grubhub

halal_reasoning: Listed as 'Halal' on Yelp. Chinese dim sum restaurant. Has official website noodumplingny.com. Health score 99/100. No official halal certification documentation found but consistently listed as halal. Sources: Yelp

name: Noor Biryani Indian Grill
halal_reasoning: Official website noorsuffern.com states 'committed to upholding the highest standards of Islamic dietary laws' and 'Halal food and products comply strictly with the principles of Shariah.' Family-run Indian restaurant specializing in halal. Sources: noorsuffern.com, Yelp

name: Noor Food Halal - West Babylon
halal_reasoning: Name includes 'Halal.' Website noorfoods.com confirms halal specialty. Described as 'embracing Indian cuisine with a halal twist.' Multiple delivery platforms list as halal. No specific certification body identified. Sources: noorfoods.com, Yelp, Grubhub

name: Noor Food Restaurant & Groceries
halal_reasoning: Established halal butchery since 2006, restaurant since 2008. Owner states 'we are professionals when it comes to halal.' Described as 'pioneers of Halal food in Suffolk county.' Featured in Newsday and NY Times. Sources: noorfoods.com, Yelp, TripAdvisor

halal_reasoning: Name explicitly states 'Halal Food.' 24-hour halal restaurant serving gyros, falafel, chicken/lamb over rice. Consistently described as halal on all platforms. Sources: Yelp, Uber Eats, DoorDash

name: Nur Thai
halal_reasoning: Won Queens Chamber of Commerce 'Best Halal Restaurant' award. Official website nurthai.com confirms halal. Customer reviews confirm 'fully halal restaurant.' Alcohol-free with mocktails only. Sources: nurthai.com, QNS.com, Yelp

halal_reasoning: Yelp reviews confirm 'halal meat written' on storefront. Described as 'casual, halal Uyghur restaurant.' Specializes in laghman and kebabs. Muslim Uyghur cuisine. Sources: Yelp, The Infatuation, Grubhub

name: NY Chicken & Rice
halal_reasoning: Conflicting information. Listed as halal on Yelp and Uber Eats (4.8 stars, 1500+ reviews). However, one reviewer claims owner said 'not halal' and questioned why listed as halal. Need direct verification. Sources: Yelp, Uber Eats
